result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathon C. Ring was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jonathon C. Ring is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jonathon C. Ring was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
3:49 p.m. Defendant Jonathon C. Ring in court with attorney Richard John Shawl. Jodie L. Bednar, Asst. D.A., appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bednar-Clemens speaks to agreement/joint recommendation. State moves to dismiss Ct. 2; granted by the Court. Plea questionnaire & waiver filed. Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 1. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea; waiver free & voluntary. Court finds factual basis for plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Bednar-Clemens/Shawl statement to sentencing. Court statement. 

Court sentence
WHS 
2 yr. POP
30 days' county jail w/Huber - commence on or before 3/6/15 at 4:00 p.m.
3 days' credit
50 hrs. community service as approved by agent
AODA assessment and follow-through
CC/CV/Supervision
DNA surcharge
Appeal Rights

03:39 pm - Defendant Jonathon C. Ring in court with attorney Richard J. Shawl.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Schiek states an offer has been made - Defense waiting to receive DVD to review prior to accepting proposal.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 10, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on December 16, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

02:45 pm - Defendant Jonathon C. Ring in court with attorney Richard J. Shawl.  Jodi Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Shawl/Defendant in receipt of Information - Waive reading.  Shawl enters not guilty pleas on behalf of defendant.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 7, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

03:33 pm - Defendant Jonathon C. Ring in court, via video, with attorney Richard J. Shawl.  Defendant Jonathon C. Ring in custody.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Noel Lawrence, under the student practice rule.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing.  Shawl/Lawrence to bond - currently set at $500 cash.  Court sets sig bond.  Prelim time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 27, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

11:01 am - Defendant Jonathon C. Ring in court, in custody.  Jodi Benar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PFO for Bloom - In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will contact PD,  Bednar/Defendant statement to bail - Court sets $ cash bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 18, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
